intro: Loasa glabra, commonly known as the smooth loasa, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Loasa glabra typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
